caption: A very pleasant garden/park that surrounds the centre piece, a tower of the same name that is all that is remaining of a gothic church, that dominated this location, the square has plenty of seating to rest and enjoy a snack or lunch, in salubrious surroundings.
I like this garden, i love the tower and it has many benches. It can get a little noisy as it is a small one and right on the main road, but i was able to sit and read my book peacefully there.
Reliable and strategically access parc in 1st arrondissement of Paris city. It‚Äôs really close to the Hotel de Ville and literally everywhere.
Small but delightful park quite well-maintained as you'd expect this close to the town hall. Wonderful trio playing music in the shade on my last visit.
It is small but a very nice park and the tower in the middle is beautiful. There  is tour available to the tower on selected days when you can get into it and can go all the way to the top.
Beautiful park to sit and enjoy the afternoon. Many benches, lots of shade and shade. Read about rats. Luckily never saw any.
I almost missed seeing this beautiful monument! It was part of a church before the French revolution, but the church was mostly destroyed and only this part remained.

This is a quiet little park in the middle of one of my favorite parts of Paris.  It is not far from the Pompidou. I did not go up in the tower but it was a nice experience all the same. There were plenty of benches to sit on with trees accompanying them to provide some shade. If the benches are full there is plenty of grass to lay on.  This is a good place to read or to have picnic with friends.
Nice place for pictures and very quiet, they have a small water fountain for drinking.
Amazing place. I've found it by chance, just coming back from Notre-Dame, but it's an amazing gothic tower and worth a visit.

This the small public park along Rue de Rivoli where you find Tour Saint-Jacques, a stand alone medieval tower that is 52 metres. The park opened in 1856. Here you will find a few park benches and grassy spots within the park but otherwise, you stop by here to see the 16th century tower. Square opening hours are 8.30am to 5.30pm daily.  Tour Saint-Jacques was originally part of a larger church built on this site between 1509-23. The church was destroyed at the end of the 18th-century and not rebuilt. What remains is the church tower which you see today. The tower is Flamboyant Gothic in architectural style and highly decorative. You can view well when approaching along Rue de Rivoli or from up close within the park.  Notice the statue to French mathematician, Blaise Pascal at the base of the tower. This is worth a quick look-see when passing by Square de la Tour Saint Jacques if you enjoy viewing monuments and statues during your travels.
Didn't get to do the tour

A surprisingly quiet spot at the centre of the city. It's very popular, but there is always a corner that you can find.
Nice garden and square
Nice last standing piece of an old gothic church, left in Paris. Worth a quick look if you're in Paris. Peaceful area.
It's ok it actually a place for stuffs you need in your house.

Beautiful breathing space in the middle of Paris. This really feels like a little oasis to hide from the hustle and bustle of the city. Wonderfully kept greenery and on a sunny days it‚Äôs just filled with people just enjoying the weather, picnicking and enjoying themselves.

This is the garden area underneath the tower of Saint Jacques. There is a gate around it and there was baboo behind the gate. We went by as we were walking to the Louvre so didn't have time to stop by and have a look. I could only see the gate that was on the main road and it didn't look too busy. You could see the statute from the gate.
Really interesting tour. Good guide! Tge view from top of the tower is superb
Such a nice, cozy park in the middle of Paris. The tower is so nice in his gothic style
Wonderful if you get to visit the tour itself and make it to the top

Cute little place, the tower is imposing and beautiful. Always a lively park full of people of every age, families with kids, groups of friends, ... Right near many other interesting places, churches, cathedrals, museums, and a walk away from Paris' art quarter. I've spent many afternoons in this park, recommended for a nice spot among the chaos of Paris.
Nice little quiet nook in an otherwise busy busy street of frenzied tourist activity.  The tower is an added bonus.
beautiful and calm little park in the mittle of the busy city and only 10 minutes away from the Notre Dame cathedral
Small and cosy park with beautiful historical tower
Thr grass is mostly green and the benches are pretty comfortable
It's a shame the tower isn't open daily. Only access if you make an appointment.
It's a open park with the tower closer to hotel de ville paris and les halles. It's quite cool place in busy paris. So many people were running relaxing. The tower view is quite interesting.
Le jardin est chic üòç best when it's sunny in winter. Read a book, steal kisses from üåû, and have a nice view. But little noisy. ‚Ä¶
Nice and quiet place in the middle of Paris.
Looks very interesting from the outside, gargoyles and architecture, but it was closed when the timetables said it would be open, so we couldn't climb it for the views. :(
The Bell tower of an old butcher's church.  Open only part of the year. Check website for info.

Quite a picturesque place, especially in the evening. The tower looks good from the outside, didn't try to go up as 10 euro seems quite steep for not so tall tower. There are other viewpoints around the city which you can visit for free.
Cute place to sit in! I ate something here and it was lovely, there is so many flowers and there is a monument in the middle! It's so cute.
It has a public bathroom, a little play area for kids, it is motor wheelchair accessible, and has lots of greenery and benches. A nice spot to have lunch!
Nice small park to sit and relax. Plenty if space. Has a public bathroom, but only one toilet and it needed some attention.

Cool tower with a small park around it. It look2d like there are tours inside it sometimes but none were offered when we stopped by. It's not far from Notre Dame so you can simply pop by when you are heading to the Cathedral.
